Description: Lower body sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery neck-amphora; interior reserved; exterior, buff slip (worn in places): confronted komasts (raised right leg and lowered left knee of first komast and left leg of second remaining); dot rosette as filling ornament.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Schaus lists the sherd as probably belonging to the Altenburg Painter. According to Cook's classification system, the sherd belongs in the Cambridge Group (named after Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.52.1899, GR.302.1899 and GR.303.1899); the human figures are rudimentary but resemble those from the Altenburg Group. See Cook 1933-1934 pls. 5, 6, 11c, for the group's namepiece, the amphora, Altenburg 191.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 84, no. 6, pl. VI, no. 6) (giving an incorrect inventory number, 1925.608f(1).)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 246, no. 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.024)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
